### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I ca n't imagine a better-written treatment of the subject .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
    - aspect_term: treatment
    - sentiment_expression: better-written
    - target_entity: subject
    - aspect_category: quality
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: strong
    - opinion_holder_span: i
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

text: I really like it.Be forewarned ( as other reviews have noted ) , this book sets up Magician 's End and you will not be particularly satisfied with the ending without keeping this in mind .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: I really like it.Be forewarned ( as other reviews have noted ) , this book sets up Magician 's End and you will not be particularly satisfied with the ending without keeping this in mind .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: really like it
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: ending
	- sentiment_expression: not particularly satisfied
	- target_entity: ending
	- aspect_category: plot
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: without keeping this in mind
	- opinion_reason: this book sets up Magician 's End

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: OMG this book had my head spinning .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: head spinning
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: Still , it was good to finish the series finally and there was some escape into the magical world ... just not as much fun to read as I had hoped .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Still , it was good to finish the series finally and there was some escape into the magical world ... just not as much fun to read as I had hoped .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
    - aspect_term: N/A
    - sentiment_expression: good to finish the series finally
    - target_entity: series
    - aspect_category: general
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: weak
    - opinion_holder_span: N/A
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
    - aspect_term: N/A
    - sentiment_expression: not as much fun to read as I had hoped
    - target_entity: series
    - aspect_category: enjoyment
    - sentiment_polarity: negative
    - sentiment_intensity: average
    - opinion_holder_span: i
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: However , if you want more details about the man in general , his family , his struggles over the years , then I would suggest Roasting in Hell 's Kitchen .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: man in general
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: man
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: N/A
	- sentiment_intensity: N/A
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: want more details about the man in general , his family , his struggles over the years

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: Roasting in Hell 's Kitchen
	- sentiment_expression: suggest
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: There is also the issue of whether various treatments were actually extending the lifespans of those afflicted , which was also not as simple as one might think.While the above discussion of science and statistics might make this book seem dreadfully boring , this is n't the case .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: treatments
	- sentiment_expression: extending the lifespans
	- target_entity: treatments
	- aspect_category: effectiveness
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: various
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: book
	- sentiment_expression: dreadfully boring
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: While the above discussion of science and statistics might make this book seem dreadfully boring
- Opinion 3
	- aspect_term: book
	- sentiment_expression: n't the case
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: Here , we see that aspect of the tale really expanded upon , elevating a lackluster minor plot thread to a level of significance worthy of Midkemia 's final chapter .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

	- Opinion N

		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Sad tale of just how easy it is for these abused children to get lost in the welfare system .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: welfare system
	- sentiment_expression: easy to get lost
	- target_entity: welfare system
	- aspect_category: effectiveness
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: abused children
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: And then we about hit rock bottom with The Demonwar Saga .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: The Demonwar Saga
	- sentiment_expression: hit rock bottom
	- target_entity: book series
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: we
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: For an avid Diana fan , the innocent day-to-day insight is appreciated , however , certain facts should not have been revealed .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: innocent day-to-day insight
	- sentiment_expression: appreciated
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: content_quality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: for an avid diana fan
	- opinion_holder_entity: N/A
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: certain facts
	- sentiment_expression: should not have been revealed
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: content_quality
	- sentiment_polarity: negative
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: I have had this on my shelf for several years for intended reading : Had I appreciated what a compelling narrative Mukherjee sets out , and how well he tells it , I would have read it much sooner.As there are numerous , good reviews of this exceptional book , I will not pile on , except to say that this is a comprehensive and detailed treatment for the non-expert , that manages to explain the science ( and some of the politics ) with clarity , while providing a compelling and often moving narrative .
res:

You are tasked with annotating a provided text for various opinion components. Follow the ontological descriptions and format guidelines to accurately capture the opinion information within the text.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: The location is unbeatable and the rooftop was beyond spectacular .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
    - aspect_term: location
    - sentiment_expression: unbeatable
    - target_entity: location
    - aspect_category: general
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: strong
    - opinion_holder_span: N/A
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
    - aspect_term: rooftop
    - sentiment_expression: beyond spectacular
    - target_entity: rooftop
    - aspect_category: general
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: strong
    - opinion_holder_span: N/A
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: There is a grocery store a 15 min walk away , which was easy to walk from with a few groceries for breakfasts and snacks .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
    - aspect_term: grocery store
    - sentiment_expression: easy to walk from
    - target_entity: grocery store
    - aspect_category: accessibility
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: weak
    - opinion_holder_span: N/A
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: with a few groceries for breakfasts and snacks
    - opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

**Annotated Output**:

- Opinion 2

    - target_entity: apartment

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Tiffany 's apartment space is the perfect spot if you 're staying in Boston .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: apartment space
	- sentiment_expression: perfect spot
	- target_entity: apartment
	- aspect_category: location
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: you
	- opinion_holder_entity: N/A
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

text: By far one of the best locations you could stay at in Boston .

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: By far one of the best locations you could stay at in Boston .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
    - aspect_term: N/A
    - sentiment_expression: one of the best locations
    - target_entity: location
    - aspect_category: general
    - sentiment_polarity: positive
    - sentiment_intensity: strong
    - opinion_holder_span: N/A
    - opinion_holder_entity: author
    - opinion_qualifier: N/A
    - opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Great location close to the Commons .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: location
	- sentiment_expression: Great
	- target_entity: location
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: close to the Commons
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: My hosts made me feel welcome the second I entered the home , helping me carry my items upstairs , explaining where everything was and offering me breakfast and coffee in the morning .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: feel welcome
	- target_entity: hosts
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: helping me carry my items upstairs , explaining where everything was and offering me breakfast and coffee in the morning
	- target_entity: hosts
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1

	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response

	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.

	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: Super crinoline for the price !

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: Super
	- target_entity: crinoline
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: for the price
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

Follow the ontology description and format guidelines to accurately annotate the opinions expressed within the input text.
**Input Text**: The transition option is nice too so you can wear them as leggings .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: transition option
	- sentiment_expression: nice
	- target_entity: transition option
	- aspect_category: functionality
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: you
	- opinion_holder_entity: reader
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: so you can wear them as leggings

### Format Guidelines:
1. Each opinion must be numbered and be annotated in the following template for generating opinion fields:
	- Opinion N
		- aspect_term:
		- sentiment_expression:
		- target_entity:
		- aspect_category:
		- sentiment_polarity:
		- sentiment_intensity:
		- opinion_holder_span:
		- opinion_holder_entity:
		- opinion_qualifier:
		- opinion_reason:
2. Only generate opinions where sentiment_polarity and sentiment_intensity are not N/A.
3. The generation should end once all the opinions are annotated.

Use the format guidelines and examples provided to annotate opinions in the given input text.
### Example 1:

**Input Text**: It 's a must read for anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: N/A
	- sentiment_expression: must read
	- target_entity: book
	- aspect_category: general
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: anyone with an interest in cancer , professional or personal
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 2:

**Input Text**: I became fascinated with Robin Hobb 's writing only six months ago when I was introduced to her fantasy series .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: robin hobb 's writing
	- sentiment_expression: N/A
	- target_entity: content
	- aspect_category: genre
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: strong
	- opinion_holder_span: i
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A

### Example 3:

**Input Text**: the screen looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution ) and the keyboard response feels pretty good .

**Annotated Output**:
- Opinion 1
	- aspect_term: screen
	- sentiment_expression: great
	- target_entity: display
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: weak
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: looks great ( though maybe not if all you do is look at 4k resolution )

- Opinion 2
	- aspect_term: keyboard response
	- sentiment_expression: pretty good
	- target_entity: keyboard
	- aspect_category: operational_performance
	- sentiment_polarity: positive
	- sentiment_intensity: average
	- opinion_holder_span: N/A
	- opinion_holder_entity: author
	- opinion_qualifier: N/A
	- opinion_reason: N/A
